text.0: i call your chariot to receive united praise mid princely men.
text.1: strong gods who pour down wealth of never vanquished might.
text.2: ye to varosusaman come nāsatyas for this glorious rite.
text.3: with your protecting aid strong gods who pour down wealth.
text.4: so with oblations we invoke you rich in ample wealth today.
text.5: when night hath passed o ye who send us plenteous food.
text.6: o aśvins heroes let your car famed best to travel come to us.
text.7: and for his glory mark your zealous servants lauds.
text.8: aśvins who send us precious gifts even when offended think of him.
text.9: for ye o rudras lead us safe beyond our foes.
text.10: for wonderworkers with fleet steeds ye fly completely round this all.
text.11: stirring our thoughts ye lords of splendour honeyhued.
text.12: with allsustaining opulence aśvins come hitherward to us.
text.13: ye rich and noble heroes neer to be oerthrown.
text.14: to welcome this mine offering o ye indralike nāsatyas come.
text.15: as gods of best accord this day with other gods.
text.16: for we like vyaśva lifting up our voice like oxen call on you.
text.17: with all your loving kindness sages come to us.
text.18: o Ṛṣi laud the aśvins well will they not listen to thy call.
text.19: will they not burn the paṇis who are nearer them.
text.20: o heroes listen to the son of vyaśva and regard me here.
text.21: varuṇa mitra aryaman of one accord.
text.22: gods whom we yearn for of your gifts of what ye bring to us bestow.
text.23: by princes hands on me ye mighty day by day.
text.24: him whom your sacrifices clothe even as a woman with her robe.
text.25: the aśvins help to glory honouring him well.
text.26: whoso regards your care of men as succour widest in its reach.
text.27: about his dwelling go ye aśvins loving us.
text.28: come to us ye who pour down wealth come to the home which men must guard.
text.29: like shafts ye are made meet for sacrifice by song.
text.30: most fetching of all calls the laud as envoy heroes called to you.
text.31: be it your own o aśvin pair.
text.32: be ye in yonder sea of heaven or joying in the home of food.
text.34: this river with his lucid flow attracts you more than all the streams.
text.35: even sindhu with his path of gold.
text.36: o aśvins with that glorious fame come hither through our brilliant song.
text.37: come ye whose ways are marked with light.
text.38: harness the steeds who draw the car o vasu bring the wellfed pair.
text.39: o vāyu drink thou of our meath come unto our drinkofferings.
text.40: wonderful vāyu lord of right thou who art tvaṣṭars soninlaw.
text.42: to tvaṣṭars soninlaw we pray for wealth whereof he hath control.
text.43: for glory we seek vayu men with juice effused.
text.44: from heaven auspicious vāyu come drive hither with thy noble steeds.
text.45: come on thy mighty car with wideextending seat.
text.46: we call thee to the homes of men thee wealthiest in noble food.
text.47: and liberal as a pressstone with a horses back.
text.48: so glad and joyful in thine heart do thou god vāyu first of all.
text.49: vouchsafe us water strength and thought.
